data.title: Talleres Azuara is involved in building a macro biodiesel plant in Brazil. Talleres Azuara
data.text:
News 04/06/2012

Talleres Azuara works with Brazil's Mater LNG SA de Brasil to build a refinery of COP in the town of Araquari, in the state of Santa Fe.

The refinery will be ready to produce 690,000 tons of bio-combustible (b100). The resulting product may be used neat or blended with diesel in proportions of 5%, 10%, 20%, or 50%.

In the refinery we will also produce the following products:

Distilled Glycerin: 80,960 tons / month

Stearin: 220,000 tons / month

Calcium Soap: 71,424 tons / month

Sodium Phosphate: 4,800 tons / month

Potassium Phosphate: 3,000 tons / month

Biomass: 15,000 tons / month

The plant will also rely on complementarian infrastructure, with which it will be able to reduce water consumption and the media-environmental impact that plant may cause. In this sense, the construction also includes the construction and commissioning of a desalination plant, a riles plant and an electric generation plant based on biomass.

Last May 28th, in Barcelona, Talleres Azuara participated, along with various Spanish companies that also took place in the construction of the biomass plant, at the meeting for the launch of the project.
